problem_text:
18.25. Let form(G) be the formation generated by a finite group G. Suppose that G has a unique composition series 1 ◁ G1 ◁ G2 ◁ G and the consecutive factors of this series are Zp, X, Zq, where p and q are primes and X is a non-abelian simple group. Is it true that form(G) has infinitely many subformations if and only if p = q?
V. P. Burichenko
